TEI:
&teiHeader; &facsimile;
28 [Prologue] Fabian Sebastian.
AL þis bok is imaked of holi dawes &punctelev; and of holie mannes liues
Þat soffreden for ore louerdes loue &punctelev; pinene manie and riue
Þat ne spareden for none ei&yogh;e &punctelev; godes weorkes to wurche
Of &yogh;was liues &yogh;wane heore feste fallez &punctelev; men redez in holi churche
Þei ich of alle ne mouwe nou&yogh;t telle &punctelev; ichulle telle of some
Ase euerech feste after oþur &punctelev; In þe &yogh;ere doth come.
Þe furste feste þat in þe &yogh;ere comez &punctelev; we cleopiez &yogh;eresdai
Ase ore louerd was circumciset &punctelev; In þe giwene lay
For to fulfullen heore lawe &punctelev; and for cristinedom non nas
Are longe þareafturward &punctelev; þat he Icristned was
¶ He was Nyne and twenti &yogh;er &punctelev; and þrettene dawes old
Are he ibaptized were &punctelev; ase þe bok us hath itold
Also it fel a twelftedai &punctelev; seint Iohan þe baptist
Baptizede in þe flum Iordan &punctelev; ore louerd Ihesu crist
In þat dai a twelfmonþe &punctelev; ore louerd was at one feste
Þare he turnde water to win &punctelev; þoru&yogh; is moder heste
We holdez also þat dai feste &punctelev; of þe þridde þinge
Ase þe þre kingues to ore louerd &punctelev; presaunt dude bringe
to him heo comen ase is moder &punctelev; achildbedde lay
After þat he ibore was &punctelev; þane þretteþe day
Ase it fallez atwelftedaiâ€” &punctelev; longe heo erore him sou&yogh;ten
gold. and. mirre. and Ansens &punctelev; In presaunt heo him brou&yogh;ten.
Seint Fabian þrettene &yogh;er &punctelev; pope was[MS. was was] In rome
he turnede mani men þat luþere weren &punctelev; into cristinedome
Decius, þat prince was &punctelev; of heþenesse þo
he let him martri þerefore &punctelev; and oþere with him mo
Vita sancti Sebastiani.
Telle ichulle of þe holi man &punctelev; seint Sebastian
he seruede ane heþe amperour &punctelev; þat het dyoclician
hext maister he was onder him &punctelev; to don al is wille
Cristine Man he was bicome &punctelev; bote þarof he heold him stille
for no doute of Martyrdom &punctelev; ake for þat he wolde longe
Serui god almi&yogh;ti, are he wolde &punctelev; deth onderfonge
Alle þe men þat cristine weren &punctelev; þat þe Aumperor ou&yogh;wer founde
Sone he let to deþe bringe &punctelev; with fuyre oþur mid wounde
&YOGH;wane ani man for cristindom &punctelev; to deþe scholde beon brou&yogh;t
Seint Sebastian heom confortede &punctelev; þat heo ne dradden heom nou&yogh;t
Deth afonge for godes loues &punctelev; Ake þat heo studefaste were
Mani he heold in þe ri&yogh;te bileue &punctelev; þat flechchi wolden for fere
¶ Marcus and Marcellian &punctelev; breþren weren tweie
Þe Aumperour for cristinedom &punctelev; Inome hadde heom bei&yogh;e
he let heom binde togadere faste &punctelev; boþe to o piler
And to þe Eorþe naylli heore fet &punctelev; þat heo ne mi&yogh;ten fer ne ner
So heo stoden al ane day and a ni&yogh;t &punctelev; þat non ne mi&yogh;ten fram oþer
Eiþur of heom ofte to oþere seide &punctelev; "here is ioye, leue broþer!"
guod it is and murie &punctelev; breþren to wonie ifere
Euere heo precheden cristindom &punctelev; mid wel glade chere
Þe Aumperor let nimen ane spere &punctelev; ase heo stoden togadere ibounde
Þoru&yogh; heore heortene he let heom smite &punctelev; þat heo deiden in a luyte stounde
Sebastian was þo iwreid &punctelev; þat he heom &yogh;af þane red
to holden op faste heore cristindom &punctelev; þei heo scholden beo ded
Þe Aumperor let him cleopie &punctelev; "Sebastian," he sede
"to þe al mi truste was &punctelev; mi lond to wissi and rede
Of alle þing þat min is &punctelev; Ich &yogh;af þe mest power
to holden op min honour &punctelev; and to saui it fer and ner
Ich habbe to þe suspecion &punctelev; Ake forsoþe ine segge it nou&yogh;t
Þat þov a&yogh;en me and a&yogh;en min honour &punctelev; Itorned hast þi þou&yogh;[t]."
Sebastian seide, "sire Aumperour &punctelev; A&yogh;en þe neuere I nas
Ake mid þe and al þine þinge &punctelev; to þin honour ich was
And ofte ich habbe ni&yogh;t and dai&yogh; &punctelev; godes sone bisou&yogh;t
Also wisliche ase he with is heorte blode &punctelev; deore us hauez ibou&yogh;t
Þat he þe &yogh;yue power gret &punctelev; and wille and eke þou&yogh;t
to leten þine false godesâ€” &punctelev; for heo ne helpeth þe nou&yogh;t."
¶ Wodwroth was þis Aumperor. &punctelev; "Sebastian," he seide
"habbe ich þus iholde þe? &punctelev; turne þi þou&yogh;t, ich rede
bote þov honouri ore godus &punctelev; to swuche pine i schal þe take
Þat, are þov beo to deþe ibrou&yogh;t &punctelev; ech lime þe schal ake."
"Sire," seide Sebastian &punctelev; "þine þretningue ne drede i nou&yogh;t
More me greuez þat þou nelt &punctelev; habbe reuþe in þi þou&yogh;t
And honouri him þat made þe man &punctelev; ant þine maumates bileue
Þat ne mouwe helpe nou&yogh;t &punctelev; for heo beoth doumbe and deue."
Þe Aumperour in grete wrathþe was &punctelev; þesne holi man he let take
And dude him leden into þe feld &punctelev; and binde him to a stake
he let archers to him scheote &punctelev; ase it were to one marke
With quareles and with Arewene &punctelev; heo maden him woundes starke
Mani on wende þoru&yogh;out him &punctelev; in a luytel &yogh;wyle
heo stikeden also þicke on him &punctelev; so yrichon deth of piles
Þo heom þou&yogh;te þat he was ded &punctelev; hom heo gonne iwende
Onbured heo bilefden him þare &punctelev; his bodi forto schenden
A cristine womman, þat hei&yogh;te Yreine &punctelev; wende þudere bi ni&yogh;te
Forto burien þat holi bodi &punctelev; &yogh;if heo it finde mi&yogh;te
heo cam and fond him hol and sound &punctelev; he nadde nou&yogh;t one wounde
With gret Ioye heo ladde him to hire hous &punctelev; and glad was þat heo him founde
¶ Þene feorþe dai Sebastian &punctelev; wende to þe Aumperour
"Sire," he seide, "ichulle þe telle &punctelev; þat fallez to þin honour
&YOGH;e misbileuez, and men doth eov &punctelev; amis to onderstonde
Þat cristine men scholden harm do &punctelev; to þe and to al þine londe
For isosteyned and isaued &punctelev; it is þoru&yogh; heore bone
More þane þoru&yogh; ouwer Maumates &punctelev; þat ne beoth nou&yogh;t wurhþ a spone
For we biddez ny&yogh;t and day &punctelev; god, þat me hidere sende
Þat he eov &yogh;iue long lijf &punctelev; &yogh;if &yogh;e eov wollez amende."
"hou is þis?" quath þe Aumperour &punctelev; "&yogh;weþur þov aliue beo
Nartþou nou&yogh;t Sebastian &punctelev; þat ich afelde let sle?"
"&YOGH;e," he seide, þis holi man &punctelev; "aliue ich am nouþe her
hol and sound, withoute wounde &punctelev; to schewen þe godus pouwer
And to schewen þat &yogh;e onri&yogh;t doth &punctelev; cristine Men to sle
For heore bileue is ri&yogh;tful and guod &punctelev; and ouwere nis wuyrth a stre
Þarefore on þine soule þench! &punctelev; ne bilef þou nou&yogh;t on a stone
Ake on him þat us deore abou&yogh;te &punctelev; þat is godes sone al one."
¶ "Ov&yogh;," seide þe Aumperovr þo &punctelev; "&yogh;ware is ovre mi&yogh;te
Schal þis þeof þoru&yogh; is wichchinge &punctelev; a&yogh;en us with wordes fi&yogh;te?"
he let nimen sebastian &punctelev; and hom to is paleis lede
For no miracle þat he dude &punctelev; to wide scholde sprede
Laste Men torneden to cristindom &punctelev; Into a priue stude he him ladde
With staues he let him to deþe beten. &punctelev; and þo heo aslawe him hadde
In one Chaumbre foreine &punctelev; amidde þe fuylthþhede
he let him honge with a ropâ€” &punctelev; and þat was a vil dede
Þat bodi forto schende &punctelev; for he hadde drede
Þat cristine Men him wolden stele &punctelev; and is bodi awei lede
bi ni&yogh;te cam þis holi Man &punctelev; to a womman, þat het lucine
And tolde hire hou he ymartred was &punctelev; and in &yogh;wuche pine
An hou filliche is bodi heng &punctelev; and þat heo ase sone ase heo mi&yogh;te
his bodi fette, and burien it &punctelev; among cristine men bi ni&yogh;te
Þis guode womman at Midni&yogh;t &punctelev; dude ase he hadde ibede
Fette þat bodi and burede hit &punctelev; In a wel fair stude
Þus seint sebastian þe holi man &punctelev; is lif brou&yogh;te to ende
And fram þe pine of is liue &punctelev; to þe blisse of heuene he gan iwende
